p: A protease inhibitor, lopinavir/ritonavir, which is commonly used to treat HIV/AIDS patients, could be used for the treatment of COVID‐19‐infected patients. Coumarin ( 62) (Figure 2e) has a broad spectrum of antiviral activity against hepatitis virus, dengue virus, chikungunya virus, and influenza virus by inhibiting viral proteins required for their entry, replication, and infection, and/or by regulation of cellular and antioxidative pathways (Mishra, Pandey & Manvati, 2020). Caffeic acid ( 63) and 5‐caffeoylquinic acid ( 64) (Figure 2e) from Achyrocline satureioides inhibit the protein HIV integrase essential for viral DNA integration into host chromatin (Khaerunnisa et al., 2020; Robinson, Reinecke, Abdel‐Malek, Jia, & Chow, 1996).
